input:
Charlie is furry. Charlie is smart. Fiona is rough. Fiona is smart. Gary is smart. Harry is quiet. Harry is smart. If something is cold and furry then it is rough. All furry things are young. White, rough things are cold. If something is rough and young then it is white. If something is smart and white then it is quiet. If something is rough and quiet then it is smart. If something is young then it is cold. If Harry is white then Harry is smart. If Harry is young then Harry is rough. Question: Charlie is not quiet.?

universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Charlie : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Furry Charlie
axiom T2 : Smart Charlie
axiom T3 : Rough Fiona
axiom T4 : Smart Fiona
axiom T5 : Smart Gary
axiom T6 : Quiet Harry
axiom T7 : Smart Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x ∧ Furry x → Rough x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Young x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Rough x → Cold x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Young x → White x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x ∧ White x → Quiet x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Quiet x → Smart x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Young x → Cold x
axiom R8 : White Harry → Smart Harry
axiom R9 : Young Harry → Rough Harry

theorem charlie_is_not_quiet : ¬ Quiet Charlie :=
begin
  sorry,
end
output:
theorem charlie_is_not_quiet : ¬ Quiet Charlie :=
begin
  intro h,
  have h1 : White Charlie, from R4 Charlie ⟨R2 Charlie T1, R7 Charlie (R2 Charlie T1)⟩,
  have h2 : Smart Charlie ∧ White Charlie, from ⟨T2, h1⟩,
  have h3 : Quiet Charlie, from R5 Charlie h2,
  contradiction,
end

-- The answer is True
